Take care and do keep us posted.
premininary diagnosis is a neuropathy potentially linked to thyroid (which is under control but may be under treated)

Hi,Thanks for the update. Thyroid issues such as hypothyroidism is an uncommon cause of peripheral neuropathy or damage to the peripheral nerves supplying the arms and legs. Hypothyroidism can cause fluid retention resulting in swollen tissues that can exert pressure on peripheral nerves. The treatment is indeed directed at managing the underlying hypothyroidism and treating the resulting symptoms. Do keep us posted with the outcome. Take care and best regards.
